• The ETA-Protected Booking Window with Auto Capacity Holds • The DDoS Attacker (Flood)\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"description\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Comprehensive lifecycle saga derived from UC-170 and persona P-15. Needs summary: Runtime availability gate primitive (signal -> action) scoped to calendars; Queue ETA signal support to create temporary unavailability windows; Capacity-hold primitive that reserves scarce capacity before final assignment; Hold lifecycle (active, released, consumed, expired, cancelled); Hold target flexibility (calendar, capacity pool, resource, offer version, custom target); Source traceability for gates/holds (queue entry, plugin, external event, manual); Deterministic conflict prevention when queue and slot channels compete for same resource\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"status\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"active\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"sourceUseCaseRef\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"UC-170\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"sourcePersonaRef\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"P-15\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"sourceUseCaseFile\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/ameer/bizing/mind/workspace/documentation/use-cases-comprehensive.md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"sourcePersonaFile\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"/Users/ameer/bizing/mind/workspace/documentation/tester-personas.md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"specVersion\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"saga.v0\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"specFilePath\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"testing/sagas/specs/uc-170-the-ddos-attacker-flood.json\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"specChecksum\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"5de0b229b1516817c4b0327c487b17752ff60ce76832e4134ae109aa86581602\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"metadata\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"tags\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"uc-derived\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"persona-derived\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"lifecycle\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"api-first\\\\
